title: Strictly’s Karen Hauer rallied round Katya Jones amid Seann Walsh snog scandal
text:
Karen rallied around her friend Katya amid the Seann Walsh drama last year (Picture: Rex/Getty)

Karen Hauer has revealed that the entire Strictly Come Dancing team ‘united’ and rallied around Katya Jones in the wake of the Seann Walsh snog scandal last year.

The pro dancer, who is currently partnered with Chris Ramsey on the show, revealed that after Katya and Seann were caught in a clinch, everyone involved protected them.

Including Katya’s husband Neil Jones, another pro on the show who Katya has since separated from.

Speaking to new! Magazine, she said: ‘Of course. When things like that happen, we unite. People like to think we go against each other, but it’s never like that backstage.

‘The worst thing would be to turn against each other. We’re all a team and always have been.’

Karen has her own unique experiences about working with an ex seeing as she and ex-husband Kevin Clifton parted ways in March 2018, but continue to work on the show together.

It’s something that Karen doesn’t regret as she confirms she’s still bonded through dance with her ex.

Katya and Seann’s illicit kiss became infamous for the rest of the year (Picture: Getty)

‘We’ve been working together for the past couple of years regardless, so for us it’s always been the same. We still love dancing together,’ she added. ‘I respect him a lot. I love to see him happy.’

Katya and Neil are now competing against each other for the first time in this year’s series, with Neil getting his first dance partner in ex-footballer Alex Scott.

Meanwhile Katya has been under the spotlight after going flying this weekend while performing with Mike Bushell causing fans to think she as drunk.

Having to insist she wasn’t drunk after falling again in a prat fall, Katya was backed up by Neil, who was accused of laughing at her as it happened.

‘So every is clear, no one was [laughing] at @mrs_katjones fall on Saturday,’ Neil wrote on Twitter.

‘We were [laughing] at the fact she styled it out and still made @mikebreakfast finish the routine and then we all said [she should] fall when she got into Claudia’s area so she did as a joke and that’s why we were [laughing] again…’

It all makes *a little* more sense now…

Strictly Come Dancing continues Saturday at 6.40pm on BBC One.
